item.title: Drug taking, 12th October
item.description:
Yesterday 2 men were hanging around in the now disused garbage collection area. When I went there today, 2 industrial nitrous oxide tubes wete left discarded. This area is becoming a hangout for drug taking, including crack smoking. It's on my (and many others') doorstep and needs to be addressed - perhaps closed up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Absolute chaos, trying to leave Waitrose Car Park, 12th October
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights for the pavement works are causing absolute chaos. What kind of impact planning and monitoring has been conducted for these works. My wife was stuck in the Waitrose car park for over 2 hours unable to get out because of these lights. Traffic chaos was exacerbated by station drop-off traffic that loops around the mini-round-about at the entry/exit to Waitrose. Something needs to be changed on the timing of these lights and the priority of the traffic because it is causing an unacceptable impact
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, High Street, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Loose paving road surface causing excessive noise on Hadlow Road, 12th October
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council, I am writing to raise a serious concern about the excessive noise being caused by the loose paving road surface at the top of Hadlow Road beside the high street next to the old library. When vehicles pass over this paved road surface there is an extremely loud continued noise caused by the loose pavement. It appears that the road paving has not been properly finished and the road tiles are very wobbly and loose throughout. This is causing significant noise disturbance and I am concerned it may worsen over time if not addressed. Could the section of the road be inspected and fixed as soon as possible. I will be a resident of the new Folio apartment development from December and wanted to bring this to your attention. Kind regards, Sam Littlefield My contact details: Email - sam.littlefd@gmail.com Phone number - 07475199616 Thank you in advance for your help and I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hadlow Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
